E

EliminationLevel - Class in model
The goal of an elimination level is to use every tile once in a UserMove (Special moves do not count) You have a certain number of moves to try to accomplish this, and if you do not mark all tiles before you run out of moves, you lose
EliminationLevel(LevelState) - Constructor for class model.EliminationLevel
Create a new EliminationLevel based off the given state Sets the number of moves remaining to the move limit of the state in addition to creating the board, etc
EliminationTopBarPanel - Class in view
Each Level type needs to display different information in the top bar Elimination levels need to show how many moves are left
EliminationTopBarPanel(EliminationLevel, LevelView, Application) - Constructor for class view.EliminationTopBarPanel
Create a new EliminationTopBapPanel for the given level and its associated levelView
empty() - Method in class model.AbstractTileContainer
 
empty() - Method in class model.BucketTileContainer
Checks to see if the Container is empty
empty() - Method in class model.NullTileContainer
 
empty() - Method in class model.NumberTileContainer
 
endLevel() - Method in class view.LevelView
When the level is finished, this invokes a new EndLevelController to show the user their score and ask them if they want to retry or return to menu
EndLevelController - Class in controller
When a level is done, this controller is run.
EndLevelController(Level, Level, LevelView, Application) - Constructor for class controller.EndLevelController
Constructs a new EndLevelController
EndLevelPanel - Class in view
The panel displayed when the player finishes a level It contains a message declaring whether the player has won or lost, showing the number of stars they earned, and asking if the want to retry or quit to the main menu
EndLevelPanel(Level, LevelView, Application) - Constructor for class view.EndLevelPanel
Construct a new endLevelPanel for the given Level If the user chooses to restart, it will replay that level
ExitLightningLevelController - Class in controller
This is a custom controller for quitting out of lightning levels, as doing so requires us to stop the timer for the level Other than that, the functionality is identical
ExitLightningLevelController(LightningLevel, Application) - Constructor for class controller.ExitLightningLevelController
 
ExitSplashScreen - Class in controller
A very basic controller, when the game starts up, the game shows a splash screen This controller allows you to click the splash screen and be taken to the main menu
ExitSplashScreen(Application) - Constructor for class controller.ExitSplashScreen
